net.hudup.core.evaluate

Interface MetricValue

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, java.io.Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ArrayMeanMetricValue, ArrayMetricValue, ErrorRange.ErrorRangeMetricValue, FractionMetricValue, MeanMetricValue, OperatorFractionMetricValue, R.PearsonTwoArrayMetricValue, RealArrayMeanMetricValue, RealArrayMetricValue, RealMeanMetricValue, RealMetricValue, RealTwoArrayMetricValue, TwoArrayMetricValue, VectorMetricValue

    public interface MetricValue
extends java.io.Serializable, Cloneable
    This interface represents value of a metric, called metric value. It can be anything but in current implementation, it only reflects real number (double number) via the method value().
    Version:
    10.0
    Author:
    Loc Nguyen

    • Method Summary

      • Methods inherited from interface net.hudup.core.Cloneable

        clone

    • Method Detail

      • value

        java.lang.Object value()
        Getting value of MetricValue. For example, such value is often mean number (average number). The returned object is often serializable. It can be geometric object.
        Returns:
        value of MetricValue.

      • isUsed

        boolean isUsed()
        Testing whether or not this metric value is used.
        Returns:
        whether or not this metric value is used.

      • accum

        void accum(MetricValue metricValue)
    throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Taking the accumulative operator. For example, the accumulative addition operator will add this MetricValue to the specified MetricValue and then, the result is set back to this MetricValue.
        Parameters:
        metricValue - specified MetricValue.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if any error raises.

      • reset

        void reset()
        Resetting this metric value. For example, its real number returned by (value()) is re-set to be 0.

      • valueToText

        static java.lang.String valueToText(MetricValue metricValue)
        Utility method to convert a metric value to text.
        Parameters:
        metricValue - specified metric value.
        Returns:
        text converted from specified metric value.

      • extractRealValue

        static double extractRealValue(MetricValue metricValue)
        Extracting real value from metric value.
        Parameters:
        metricValue - specified metric value.
        Returns:
        real value extracted from metric value.
